items.title: Training session complete!
items.content:
Thank you for training today. At your next training session, you will need to give the following password to continue training from where you last finished: ${this.state.password}. Please take a note of this password somewhere to remember it.

See you next time!
Because you did not get all trials correct in the test, you will now start training again.

95.title: timer_frame

items.label: If you have completed the training before, please type the password you were last given below.
items.name: password
items.help: To remind you, the password is a 4-digit number. If this is your first time, just leave the answer blank.

messageHandlers.code:
this.state.password = this.state.password.toUpperCase();
this.state.password = this.state.password.replace(/\s+/g, '');

items.label: Is this your first time completing this training?
items.name: first_time

items.content: Each stage begins with the training phase. Once you get 16 responses correct in a row in this phase, you will be moved on to the testing phase. If you get 16 responses correct on this phase, then you move on to the next stage of training. If you get even just one answer wrong, then you must start the training phase again.

In this training, you will train your ability to relate concepts together in increasingly complex ways.
This training consists of 50 stages. Each stage consists of two phases: a training phase, and a testing phase. In both phases, you will be presented with some information about how made-up words are related (e.g., CUG is the same as JOM, JOM is the same as VEK), and you will need to answer a question based on this information (e.g., is CUG the same as JOM?).
In the training phase, you will get feedback after each response telling you if you were correct or wrong. In the testing phase, you will not receive this feedback.

Once you click "continue", you will begin training for 30 minutes. In this time, please make sure to pay attention as best as you can, and not be distracted.
Click "continue" to begin.
